name: CancelOrder
description:
Cancel a complete order or a subset of lines.

The order can be identified by an OrderID or by BackendID + BackendSystemID, the lines can be identified by an OrderLineID or by BackendID.

The result will tell you if it was successful.

properties.name: BackendID
properties.description: Reference to the order that is being cancelled - required when `OrderID` is omitted

properties.name: BackendSystemID
properties.description: Reference to the system from which the order originated - required when `OrderID` is omitted

properties.name: OrderID
properties.description: ID of the order that is being cancelled - required when `BackendID` and `BackendSystemID` are omitted

properties.name: OrderLines
properties.description: Lines to cancel - or, if none are specified, all open lines of the order will be cancelled

properties.name: BackendID
properties.description: Reference to the orderline that is being cancelled - required when `OrderLineID` is omitted

properties.name: OrderLineID
properties.description: ID of the orderline that is being cancelled - required when `BackendID` is omitted

properties.name: Quantity
properties.description: Quantity to be cancelled. If left blank the full order line will be cancelled

properties.name: Code
properties.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

properties.name: RequestID
properties.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: A short description of the error type.

properties.name: ExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

properties.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
properties.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

properties.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
